metadata.title: CVE-2020-11884 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel 4.19 through 5.6.7 on the s390 platform, code executionmay occur because of a race condition, as demonstrated by code inenable_sacf_uaccess in arch/s390/lib/uaccess.c that fails to protectagainst a concurrent page table upgrade, aka CID-3f777e19d171. A crashcould also occur.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-11884` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-99-generic - 4.15.0-99.100
linux-image-4.15.0-99-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-99.100
linux-image-4.15.0-99-lowlatency - 4.15.0-99.100
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-99-generic - 4.15.0-99.100
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-99-lowlatency - 4.15.0-99.100
No subscription required

linux-image-5.3.0-51-generic - 5.3.0-51.44~18.04.2
linux-image-5.3.0-51-generic-lpae - 5.3.0-51.44~18.04.2
linux-image-5.3.0-51-lowlatency - 5.3.0-51.44~18.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-5.3.0-51-generic - 5.3.0-51.44~18.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-5.3.0-51-lowlatency - 5.3.0-51.44~18.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1083-azure - 4.15.0-1083.93
No subscription required

linux-image-5.3.0-1019-aws - 5.3.0-1019.21~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-gcp - 4.15.0-1071.81
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1013-raspi - 5.4.0-1013.13~18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-99.100').
linux-hwe package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-51.44~18.04.2').
linux-azure-4.15 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1083.93').
linux-aws-5.3 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-1019.21~18.04.1').
